1.title: Norte
1.plot: The divinity of wind, in the Region of Tarapacá, is shown in music through three referents that are related with traditional roots: the collective, festivities and the purpose. The band "Los Wiracocha" in the town of "La Tirana" and the "Sikuris de Quebe" at the aymara altiplano from the Colchane commune, all together create an atmosphere of sonorities, roots, landscapes and views of the world that are all present in the north of Chile.

2.title: Centro
2.plot: The sound that evokes perseverance and trance, underlie in the interpretation of the Chilean guitar, the singing to divinities and the "chino" dances. In the limit of urban and rural landscape, these actors make the music from the central Chile, travel through the patrimony, the metric and into their skills, elements that all together, are particularized in the geography of Pirque and Pachacamita, and that together with other factors, make possible the comprehension of it's ethnographic sound.

3.title: Sur
3.plot: The accordion and the mapuche songs are the protagonist of a contemporary time that is born as a consequence of the process of adopting and adapting the musical expressions, rooted to culture both pre Hispanic as well as those that arrived during the Spanish conquest period. The devotion, farm work and it's fusion with nature, are encouragements from which the sounding identity of a geographical and sociocultural icon such as the Archipelago of Chiloé, are argued.

imdb.plot outline: Music, identity and landscape. Three concepts that together are in constant relation creating a representative selection of the endemic sounds of Chile. Divided in three chapters, each corresponding to one section of the immense national landscape, the documentary observes the different cultural expressions and, as a consequence, the diverse melodic roots which, all together, create the origin of the Chile's musical identity.
imdb.title: Etnográfica
plot: Music, identity and landscape. Three concepts that together are in constant relation creating a representative selection of the endemic sounds of Chile.
